measured_by: PEST stair-climbing choice task (choices between money vs mug requiring 45-270 stair steps)
justification: “Participants made a series of choices between an effortless monetary payoff or an item associated with a given level of effort… This procedure allows for the collection of data on choices made by participants with parametrically changing properties… included the nominal value and effort associated with the choice alternatives.”

“As a manipulation check, participants were asked to evaluate their final choice in each effort block … in terms of how much they liked each option … These evaluations were performed on a Likert scale ranging from 1 to 7.”
“Participants were asked to evaluate … how confident they were in their final choice (for details, see Supplemental Material). These evaluations were performed on a Likert scale ranging from 1 to 7.”

measured_by: Effort demand rating of stair-climbing steps
justification: “Results showed that effort demand ratings significantly increased with the number of steps performed… This validation confirms that our task manipulation influences perceived effort as intended.”
